title: 113_hr5783
content: The Act may be cited as the "Children's Savings Accounts Offer Parents Plenty Of Reasons To Understand and Invest in Tuition Yearly Act" or the "CSA OPPORTUNITY Act". Definitions are provided in the Act. The Act defines a child's savings account as a trust for qualified expenses of an individual under 18, with requirements for trustee and investment direction. The trust for qualified expenses of an individual under 18 must not commingle assets, and any amount in the trust can only be used for paying qualified expenses after receiving a secondary school diploma or its equivalent. The trust can be used for postsecondary educational expenses, purchasing a first home, or capitalizing a business owned by the individual. Amendments to the Social Security Act require disregarding interest and distribution from a qualified tuition program under the TANF program. Amendments to the Social Security Act mandate disregarding interest and distribution from a qualified tuition program for TANF program eligibility and assistance. Penalty for noncompliance is also outlined. The Secretary will reduce the grant to a State under section 403 if they fail to comply with section 408(a)(13), with a reduction of 1-3% for consecutive findings of noncompliance. The grant reduction for noncompliance with section 408(a)(13) will be 1-3% for the 2nd consecutive finding and 3-5% for the 3rd or subsequent consecutive finding. Section 409(b)(2) of the Act is amended to include an exception for reasonable cause. SEC. 102 amends the Social Security Act to exclude interest in or distributions from a qualified tuition program from resources under the SSI program. SEC. 103 requires child's savings accounts to be disregarded under the TANF program. SEC. 104 amends the Social Security Act to exclude the value of a child's savings account from resources under the SSI program. Amendment to the Social Security Act excludes child's savings account value from SSI program resources. Amendment to the Social Security Act modifies paragraph numbers and redesignates them. Amendment to the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 excludes child's savings accounts from allowable financial resources under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program. This amendment aims to define and exclude the value of funds in any child's savings account from being considered as financial resources. The Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Act of 1981 is amended to exclude child's savings accounts from household income calculations for the program. This amendment aligns with a similar exclusion in the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.
